website_summaries.verdict: Those who are seeking a sandal that offers loads of comfort and lightness may do well with this KEEN pair. Indeed, it may be up to par with the expectations of trail enthusiasts because of its ability to be cleaned easily and minimal break-in period.On the other hand, its restrictive toe box may cause disappointment. All in all, the KEEN Venice may remain a competent sandal that provides performance water hikers with what they need, as long as potential buyers try them out for size first.
pros: A majority of KEEN Venice sandal reviews from verified buyers say that it is an exceptionally comfortable sandal for hiking
Its lightweight design brings delight to numerous trail lovers who have used it during a trip or for their daily routine
Countless adventurers comment that cleaning this KEEN offering is very easy
According to a bunch of shoppers, the Venice’s break-in period is close to zero
Its underfoot support leaves a handful of purchasers in awe
A minority of outdoor enthusiasts commend the grip of this sandal on virtually all types of terrain
cons: Several customers lambast the KEEN Venice for sporting a narrow toe box
Some wearers mention that the footgear’s opening is quite small, making on and off harder
A few declare that it is slightly expensive

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical at first, I am now a convert!
customer_reviews.text: The first couple of times I wore these, they were a bit disappointing and I was on vacation overseas and thought it was bad luck that they would be so uncomfortable. But, I think it was a matter of breaking them in because they are super comfy now! I can walk for hours with these on and they feel great! I recommend these highly. The color is super cute. Your feet breathe well because of the design and they feel light on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Sized wrong
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to sandal. I have 4 other pairs. The two pairs I just purchased were both to small at the opening where you put your foot through. First time I have had that happen. Always 100% satisfied in the past. I even ordered 1/2 size larger because one review mentioned to do that as they had a problem. The length was fine, just the top opening is visually smaller. I will try and stretch them because the price was so good. If I had paid full price they would be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Keene. Nothing like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair, identical to mine that are 10 plus years, as my old ones which are still in perfect shape are covered in paint . I have worn them on walking trips , doing heavy yard work and painting my house . I needed a pair that were not stained and paint splattered. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Biernacki

customer_reviews.title: 2ND PAIR!
customer_reviews.text: These are the original Keen Venice waterproof sandals. Bought my first pair AT LEAST 15 years ago and they are still 100%...just slippery smooth on the bottoms so I decided to buy another pair while they were still available. I love these sandals! They are not hot and don't clamp your feet the way other Keen water sandals (Newport, Whisper) do. Great for camping/hiking-take these along for after the hike and my feet are very happy. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: divine55

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy -good grip
customer_reviews.text: I wore these all over Greece this summer. Protects your toes and doesn't get hot. They are kinda heavy by today's standards, but I don't mind it too much except for weight in suitcase. You will pick up pebbles on certain paths, but I noticed a lot of other people were slipping on the marble paths and I wasn't. good tread. I noticed one of our tour guides wore them too. I like to wear with socks.
customer_reviews.author: JOWI

customer_reviews.title: So being able to wear a shoe that is not horribly ugly (the leather does spruce them up quite a ...
customer_reviews.text: I was that person that said they would never wear these. I mean they are not attractive, let's be honest. But the comfort, durability, traction, ​and breathability are all worth it! I am a photographer, I am in and out of rivers, lakes, the ocean you name it! So being able to wear a shoe that is not horribly ugly (the leather does spruce them up quite a bit) and that I can go from land to water no problem is a must. I seriously don't own a pair of comfier shoes. I even wore them to Target *gasp* that's how comfy they are!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: These are just what I hoped for! I am in between an 8 1/2 and a 9. I chose the 9 and they are perfect. The box is wide enough to accommodate my bunions. The ties can be pulled up tighter as I have narrow feet. They are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Kaskel

customer_reviews.title: Love this supportive - comfy sandal
customer_reviews.text: This is my first leather pair of this style. The initial feel is on the stiffer side. After wearing them for a short time inside and today outside---they have loosened up already. Overall I am happy so far. The leather may wear differently over time? I have seen some quality decline w/some of Keen shoes. However, this brand is still my first choice for most shoes and always boots. The price was a fantastic deal!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased a pair of Venice sandals about 4 years ago on the recommendation of my doctor. After several foot/ankle problems and a surgery I needed a good supportive shoe, preferably a sandal. These fit the bill perfectly. I've worn them frequently for 4 years and they're finally starting to show wear. I bought a second pair when I saw them on the Amazon daily deal... and purchased a pair for my daughter as well. I normally wear an 8.5 wide shoe. I wear a size 9 in this sandal. The 8.5 fits as well, but I prefer my shoes a bit looser. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Jan M.

customer_reviews.title: Lace broke within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I got these in early June and yesterday (July 23rd) one of the laces just came apart. Apparently broken laces aren't included in the Keen warranty. None of the rest of the sandal is worn down at all. I guess the laces just aren't that tough. Otherwise the sandals were very good - great arch support, fit exactly as expected. I was using them to run on the beach - to save my actually running shoes from possibly getting wet. Not sure what I'll do now - can't send these back and Keen wont stand behind them. Can't wear shoes without laces.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Penny

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I chose the Venice (instead of the Newport or the Venice H2s). I have wide feet, and read that these have quite a bit of room in the toe box. I'd imagine that if you have narrow feet, it might be quite roomy. I broke these in over the course of two days camping---it involved walking 2-3 miles per day, so I'd imagine that in a day-to-day environment, it might take longer. The first day or two was somewhat uncomfortable, but by day 3, they fit like a glove and couldn't be more comfortable! I especially love the soft sole (leather?) and the toe protection.
customer_reviews.author: jjjack

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoe. Great for walking, just a little wide but wearing socks just right for me. Very comfortable, no breaking in. My feet are narrow only one width. They hold up well, had the other pair more than a couple years and walk twice a day. If weather permits this is what I wear. Linda
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: The all around utilitarian sandal.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect sandal for travel and every day wear. It protects your feet heel to toe, great for hiking, walking and canoeing, all-terrain’s. When traveling this shoe fits the bill, it will take a sock and you can go through security easily at the airport... No other shoe is needed in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Conscious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed this time around
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in late winter -- too late now to return them. The leather Venice sandals didn't fit anything like the original Venice sandals I wore and loved for years. They are too short by at least a half-size.
customer_reviews.author: Life-long student

customer_reviews.title: Keen Venice Sandals Rock with one exception
customer_reviews.text: The product is rugged and sturdy. Love the brown leather and aqua accents and comfortable doesn't begin to describe how good these feel. They're good in water and stay on better than my old tevas. Great for hiking and cooler than hiking shoes. The problem is with pebbles. I bought these specifically for the pebbly beaches and hiking in Greece but have decided not to bring them because of that issue. The pebbles get in but you have to take the shoe off to get them out. Overall, love them and Backcountry shipped them "wicked fast"!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of sandals
customer_reviews.text: I bought these last minute to wear at a camp I was volunteering at. I was hesitant that they wouldn't be comfortable and needed to be broken in (didn't have time for that of course). Thankfully, these didn't need to be broken in. They were comfortable from day #1! I can see these holding up a long time too. They seem sturdy. I wore them for 10+ hours a day with no issues! They're the perfect outdoor sandal for summer time, because they're comfortable and look great.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Keen sandle fan!
customer_reviews.text: I already had this sandle in the canvas version, which were very comfortable right out of the box. These leather ones are a bit tighter out of the box but do loosen to an acceptable comfort level after they have been wet and then worn. One stitch also was rubbing but bar soap rubbed over it did the trick. The synthetic footbed is a bit hot feeling through the summer in the canvas style but is a bit better with these leather ones as they have a footbed liner. As I have a lot of trouble finding wider shoes, these have proven well worth the money and I have bought a third pair now in case they stop making them!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. P.

customer_reviews.title: Love these so much I can say enough good things ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these so much I can say enough good things about them. I wear them all the time and they are the most comfortable thing I put on my feet. I have owned them for over a year now and they are holding up great. I just got some cleaner that is recommended by Keen and they look almost like new again. I will buy these over and over again till the day I die.
customer_reviews.author: Jerermy Weston

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect !
customer_reviews.text: I have several pair of Keen's venice sandals now. They are so comfortable and with my problem feet I can wear them all day long without discomfort. My only "problem" with this particular pair is the color. They are such a pretty shade of green on the website but in reality they are a very dark moss color. Almost brown. Very disappointed with that because the color on the website is so pretty and they caught my eye immediately. (really didn't need another pair but loved that color). And because they work so well for me I am keeping them. Comfort is obviously more important than color anyway !
customer_reviews.author: Linda S.

customer_reviews.title: These run very, very small, unless my pair was mis-marked.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my wife in a size 8 1/2, since the last 3 pair she had were size 8 and she wanted a scosh more room. She couldn't even get them on her food. Yes, I checked the inside and it definitely said that they were 8 1/2, but they were more like a 7 1/2 or 8. I couldn't answer anything but the first question, since my wife couldn't even get them on her feet. I'll have to send them back and get another pair.....not sure if the sizing this was just a fluke or if they all run small. May have to call first to see. Exchanged for a size 9 and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A. Kozisek

customer_reviews.title: but I saw that on a review before I ordered them so just upped my size and it is great!! and they wear for a long time
customer_reviews.text: ladies sizes run about a half size smaller than most shoes ... but I saw that on a review before I ordered them so just upped my size and it is great!! and they wear for a long time.... I wore my 1st pair of this style Keen for 2 years.. day in and out before the sole of it wore thru. 1st pair was so great that I ordered these and another color for variety... but I have worn them in water sports, floods, and just daily wear like sandals for past couple years.... most awesome shoe ever !!! (yes, I live in PHX Arizona... )
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a little hard on my feet not as comfortable. I have problems with my heals
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting the sole to be a little softer. Its a little hard on my feet not as comfortable. I have problems with my heals. I have these sandals for almost 2 months now. I bought them to walk long distances. I have wore them under the sun and under heavy rain here in Orlando Florida. They are good for the rain to walk under the rain they good but not as comfortable as sneakers to walk when there is no rain.
customer_reviews.author: diana

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent for my wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a very odd size (Men's 6 1/2 double wide), and never get something that fits right off without extensive breaking in. 2 different keens have fit perfectly out of the box. And everyone comments on how good these look. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eric_VR-4

customer_reviews.title: wanted a comfortable walking shoe for work
customer_reviews.text: wanted a comfortable walking shoe for work, w/vents. these are sporty (ie not exactly ugly) not fond of blunt toe, don't like ballerina shoe look, prefer narrower, but @ age where comfort trumps looks. these are great. have b width feet but left is bigger? sometimes a little tight, these because blunt tops are nice and wide and roomy. the vents are great, not too strappy, busy looking, just the right amount. back was comfortable tho not adjustable per se but the front elastic adjustment cord takes care of that. wore them all day, then went for walk afterwards. great shoe. great color which no one wanted so got @ about half price, can't beat that. will buy keen again.
customer_reviews.author: g y

customer_reviews.title: I can walk In them all day !
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace an older pair, I have and still wear afters years of use. They are very comfortable, I can walk in them all day without any foot fatigue. I love the softer insole and arch support. I never worry about them when walking on trails or rocks, my feet , and ankles are well supported, and my toes are protected. I don't feel as confident in other sandals. I always worry a strap will break off. No other sandal makes me feel as confident walking for long or hiking. I will always buy these sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Annabella

customer_reviews.title: nice comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like the color and they are very comfortable. The insole is shaped a bit differently than the "Whisper" model, so I had to get used to that. The best feature for me on the Venice and Whisper is the toe cap. It does a good job protecting you from stubbing your toes without looking too clunky​.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THE KEENS!!
customer_reviews.text: Do I really need to do a commercial for these shoes? Anyone who wears Keens knows what they’re about.. arch support, good traction, VERY comfortable, wore these all summer. Adjustable lacing. (No tying). Can be worn in other seasons with socks. Like fall or spring...AND.....they can go in the washer or sink or be hosed off if they’re dirty. I put mine on the deck to dry.
customer_reviews.author: pattypink

customer_reviews.title: good for narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: I wore this Venice style in the past in the same size as these, but this time, in the leather version, they are too narrow in the width. The front cross straps don't reach the middle and show the underlying beige fabric after adjusting the laces to fit. If I force the laces so the leather reaches the center strip, they are way too tight.
customer_reviews.author: janie mcc

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The soles of these sandals/walking shoes are perfectly formed and softened; they hug my feet, and the more I wear them they seem to mold to the shape of my feet. They can handle rugged areas, like hiking shoes, and they can also look good, as a comfy, casual shoe to wear out shopping and such. I wore these on a stony beach for a 2 mile walk, and they were comfortable. If they get sand and seawater on them, it takes just a quick rinse, and bingo, they’re clean. I am pleased with these. A little pricey, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: RJS

customer_reviews.title: Runs large
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe but runs large. I bought a women's 6 and returned it. I ended up buying a kids 3.
customer_reviews.author: luv2shop

customer_reviews.title: Runs big
customer_reviews.text: I loved this shoe but it runs large. I always wear a size 8 shoe but need a 7.5 in this shoe and unfortunately it isn't available. Great color and my previous, almost identical, Keen lasted years and years.
customer_reviews.author: katinka

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable. We spend a lot of time out in the forest and at age 68 I need something that will help me get my grip when I head down a small trail. I am going to order a second pair because they changed the insole and it has some small bumps I do not care for. This is smooth and it's what I like. Very nice shoe. Fits well, last well.
customer_reviews.author: Sera

customer_reviews.title: I am really keen on my Keens
customer_reviews.text: I love these sandals. This is my third pair. I originally bought them to go hiking as I wanted something sturdy but able to go through water, without the weight of hiking boots/shoes. These hold up really well and I have worn them for long walks through salt water and marshy terrain and they have held up really well. They are very comfortable and keep my feet cool yet protected. I will always have a pair of these as long as they make them. On top of all the practical stuff, they look great as well!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wade

customer_reviews.title: Consistent comfort, iconic style.
customer_reviews.text: Soooooooooo comfortable! have had newports (too sweaty, outgrew them), targhee (loved these, dog ate them) and Venice h2s (perfection!). Wore the Venice h2s til they fell apart years later. Tried the leather ones and really love them so far! The black olive color is really nice and neutral. I think I like the leather ones better than the textile ones, but haven't had them very long. Could wear these all day every day!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: LittleVTwin

customer_reviews.title: This is my third pair!
customer_reviews.text: These sandals have great arch support. The footbed is antimicrobial so when you take them off, your feet and your shoes don’t stink. They are real leather and have bungee laces so they can expand if you have problems with swelling in your feet. And they are truly washable! I throw mine in the washing machine and air dry them. I love these shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: tikihutdreamer

customer_reviews.title: I can walk in these all day they're so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've had a pair of Keen Venice sandals for years (and they are still good) but I loved the color of these. The only thing I would change is the color of the sole and toe. Keens gray or neutral color would have looked better than the black. This sandal is so comfortable I truly live in them in the warm weather.
customer_reviews.author: KACS.

customer_reviews.title: my sister loves them
customer_reviews.text: OK I gave these 5 stars because my sister loves them. I got them for me and took a chance ordering a 10 because I thought they ran large. My sister has very slightly shorter size 10 feet and they were perfect for her. I checked not enough arch support for this review because I didn't think the arch support was great but again, they were perfect for my sister. If you need extra arch support they would be fine for a couple of hours I guess but my sister's normal arch feet can wear them all day.
customer_reviews.author: vondaleu

customer_reviews.title: My Venice Sandles
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of Keen sandals I have purchased. I have the Whisper and Newport. I have an issue with Neuropathy in my feet. I love Keen but these are by far the best fitting I own. There is a little extra space with having only 2 straps across my lower foot making them very comfortable. I went a half size up from my usual size 10. They fit perfect. I have worn them with short, my capris, and my jeans. They look great with everything I wear. I love them and will be purchasing more. I would totally subject them to anyone that needs some very supportive souls with great arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Deon F. Winchester

customer_reviews.title: Wide and Short
customer_reviews.text: This a great looking sport sandal. Comfy footbed, well designed. Love the Mineral/ Amber color combo. My only issue is with the fit, they run short and wide. I usually wear a M width, these are very loose from the arch to the toe box. Elastic in the heel keeps it from being loose. If not for the fit issue, they'd be an easy 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: PJay

customer_reviews.title: If you are between two sizes order the larger size.
customer_reviews.text: This sandal was an 8 1/2 and it was snug and lightly touched my longest toe, so it seemed shorter than the last pair of Keen sandals I bought, but they were open toed. I chose close toed because they protect delicate feet. I had to really pull to get the sandals over my heels, but then they fit like a glove. I had to wear thin socks as thick socks squeezed my toes. I walked several miles in these sandals each day on vacation and they were durable. I liked the color, especially for summer.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Cute but Newport is more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the Newport and can wear the Newport 15 miles a day no problem. These are cuter, and they are more substantial than the Whisper, but they are not as substantial as the Newport. Seem a bit narrower, footbed feels a bit warmer, there is a spot that I can see would rub uncomfortably if I were to wear them more than an hour. If you like a bit toebox, if you are overweight, if you need a substantial shoe, or if you will be walking 10 miles a day, then get the Newport. Otherwise you might prefer this shoe over the Newport - it is cuter.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Best fitting Keens model for me
customer_reviews.text: Four years ago I bought 2 pairs of Keen whispers. Very similar design but a little too narrow. These are perfect in the same size. Great with and without socks.
customer_reviews.author: D. U. Cahn

customer_reviews.title: Strong support for a sandal
customer_reviews.text: Keeping this pair for good. I have an old pair that I use for gardening. Sole is strong enough to use planting. They do get out of shape and stretch a bit after getting wet a number of times.
customer_reviews.author: judith houser

customer_reviews.title: Ordered my regular size and they were to small so got a half size bigger
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for camping and 1st time I wore them I got blisters from them rubbing, but my husband swears they are comfortable once broke in so I’ll give them a chance
customer_reviews.author: Melissa piccolo

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Keens
customer_reviews.text: I own four pairs of Keens, but these sandals are, by far, my favorite. They've got great arch support, and a hard sole so you don't feel the rocks through your shoes when you're hiking. But they are also lightweight, easy to slip on and off, and the colors are great. I wear mine constantly in the summer from hiking to walking the dog. They're equally comfortable on bare feet and with socks underneath. I also think they are the most feminine looking of Keen's sandal options.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Webster

customer_reviews.title: Another favorite style of Keen's
customer_reviews.text: Keen is my go to brand for hiking and walking footwear and I love these as I have all my others. They seem to be wearing quite well, as usual. I love this color. The strapping is a little more open than the last style of sandals that I chose and I occasionally get rocks in them. Without the velcro that has been on other styles they are a little more challenging to get those rocks out but that is a small thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Opp

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed when the color that arrived seemed much different from ...
customer_reviews.text: I lost my previous pair so I went on to Amazon (where I bought the last pair) and clicked that I wanted to buy them again. I was disappointed when the color that arrived seemed much different from the color I bought last time. They are still the same comfortable sandals but much darker color than I was expecting. After I had worn the new ones, I found my old ones which confirmed that Amazon didn't send me the same color. :(
customer_reviews.author: raccoon1

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this walking sandal!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best shoe purchases I have made in years. I have very hard feet to fit shoes to-65 years old, need support and I have a large bunion on one foot, high instep.. There is the support I need in these sandals, plus the straps and cutouts are just right so that they don't bother my bunion. I took these sandals right out of the box, put them on, and walked a mile and my feet felt great-no sore spots, no aching feet, knees, or hips. I would recommend these to anyone!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: This sandal runs small go up an extra half to a full size.
customer_reviews.text: This sandal runs small, runs I went up a size but my toe is still at the top, I think it is because the leather is stiff and there is not much give. I am keeping the larger size and hope they will give a little in time.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley

customer_reviews.title: Comfy walking sandal
customer_reviews.text: I have temperamental feet, that is, shoes that are supposed to be ergonomic walking shoes sometimes won't fit me. So I have spent lots of $$$ searching for shoes that don't hurt my feet. A friend recommended Keen sandals; I have tried several styles and this is the one that works for me. I have so far walked distances of 3-5 miles in these sandals without any problems at all. They are soft on the inside against the foot so there are no blisters at friction points. The straps are widely spaced so the foot has a lot of air circulation. I recommend these walking sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Number 7 of 9

customer_reviews.title: Not like previous Keens
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair of Keens (same style/style). I have always loved them but these don't fit as well, and they feel very stiff. I've worn them for a week, hoping they would soften/loosen up a bit, but no. I usually wear Keens with socks (my feet don't like bare inner soles). But even with socks, I'm feeling a blister starting to develop. I'm really disappointed, because I wear Keens for walking, hiking, trips to the gym, etc. I've been thinking about sending them back, but I've worn them for a week. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: KSWinCA

customer_reviews.title: NOT OLIVE GREEN
customer_reviews.text: As I am older, I can only wear Keen shoes. Anything else and my feet are tired. That being said these are not olive at all. More like Brown...If you are expected olive...it's not olive.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 2 week trip to Europe and love them., especially at the discounted price ($30)! It did not require any break in time, whatsoever. I have narrow feet and these fit fine. I had to really cinch the pull cord on top. They provided nice support for cobblestone streets, even when wet. It rained a couple of times making the cobblestones slick and the shoe provided excellent grip. The sandals are waterproof - meaning water won't ruin the leather/shoe portion, not that the sandals will keep your feet dry.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandal design!
customer_reviews.text: The only Keen sandal I have found which does not irritate the bunion areas of both of my feet is the Venice Sandal. This purchase was my sixth pair! Why it is not available in black or red in size 8.5 escapes me. I searched everywhere online to no avail. But it's a great sandal for those with bunion. I have not had as good luck with the canvas model of the Venice.
customer_reviews.author: Micajah

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals.  Fit a little big.
customer_reviews.text: I love Keen sandals. I have another pair, but the size wore off on the inside so I wasn't 100% sure what size to order. I always buy a 9 1/2 for my New Balance sneakers. So I bought a 9 1/2 in these sandals and they are big. I could have got away with a 9. Luckily, they tighten pretty well and I was able to make them work. I bought them for a trip and needed them asap so I kept them or I probably would have sent them back for a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I put these on my feet, they fit perfectly and comfortably in the size shoe that I always wear. I love the large broad size of the hard rubber toe for added protection when hiking on rocks and in streams. The sole is very heavy durable leather tread, for long lasting and comfortable wear. I love the ankle support I feel with this particular design. They seem very durable, and work great in all weather conditions. I have challenges finding shoes that fit properly and comfortably, and took a chance by ordering without first trying them on, but I credit the great fit to the fine Keen quality.
customer_reviews.author: Charming

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: What can I say I love Keens! They are about the only shoe I wear all year long. I buy a few pairs every year. If you haven't tried them you should but be warned they are a bit on the wide side if you get the traditional soles ones like these. There are more narrow versions now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: They look well made and would otherwise be quite comfortable. I bought a second pair of Keen sandals ...
customer_reviews.text: With the first pair I bought the shoe size I usually do but the sandals felt a little snug i.e. too short. If I could reorder I would get them a half size larger. They look well made and would otherwise be quite comfortable. I bought a second pair of Keen sandals and tried a half size larger than my usual size and they fit fine. They are very well made. I would recommend ordering a half size large.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Size up!
customer_reviews.text: After 3 tries I finally found the right size I needed to size up . I normally wear an 8.5to 9. I needed a 10. I also have a narrow foot. These are fine. Adjusting helps too. I ordered a few different styles of keen, this one feels best for me. I need support for walking.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. D

customer_reviews.title: Love these keens
customer_reviews.text: I got both the Olive/Surf and Coriander/Olive because I wasn't sure which color I'd prefer. Well, I'm going to keep them both, I think. I have other Keens, but these are the first that have the leather sole and I think it will make a difference. It feels great on the sole of my foot and I imagine the sweat factor won't be there (those rubber soled Keens get stinky!). While I wear a 1/2 size up in other Keen sandals, I got these in my regular shoe size and they fit perfectly. I'm very much looking forward to wearing these this summer!
customer_reviews.author: R. Finlayson

customer_reviews.title: I love my Keens
customer_reviews.text: I love my Keens ! My older pair are the same size, but slightly stretched out now that they are about 8 years old. These almost felt snug when I first put them on, but I think they'll relax a little when they're not so new:)
customer_reviews.author: Andrea P. Flohr

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Snugger in the forefoot than I expected, but they fit in my normal size and the snugness means less of that sloppy sandal feel. I can imagine hiking or even jogging in these. No rough seams or edges inside mean no sore spots or blisters. Good support. For reference, I am flat-footed and have a wide foot overall.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Sandals!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Keen Venice sandal. I have somewhat wide feet. This sandal is comfortable, stable and great for walking or hiking. Getting them wet in streams and lakes or rain is not a problem. I have been wearing this same sandle for several years and I hope that Keen continues to make the exact same sandle for many more years.
customer_reviews.author: gamekat

customer_reviews.title: Ties loosen as you walk
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were going to be a great Keen product. My problem with them? They bungee ties loosen as you walk so you're constantly bending over to tighten them and the looseness causes rubbing and blisters. Wore them while on vacation last summer but they'll probably end up in the Goodwill bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Jtap

customer_reviews.title: I do love this shoe with socks on
customer_reviews.text: I do love this shoe with socks on, rubs a bit without after a while. I would never hike in them without socks and after a four mile hike in them, I might not hike in them at all. Just not a lot of support in a sandal. It's also a huge pain if something gets in them, like a rock, which happens every time i where them. But i still love them.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Heel strap too tight
customer_reviews.text: These would have been just right if the heel strap were adjustable, but my toe was jammed into the front too tightly.
customer_reviews.author: cyrus

customer_reviews.title: No Blisters!
customer_reviews.text: I took 2 different trips to the California coast with 2 different friends. We did quite a bit of walking along the bluff trails above the ocean. Both friends wore KEEN sandals which I had never heard of. I was wearing a newer pair of walking shoes and got horrible blisters on the first trip that weren't healed by the 2nd trip. I always get blistered before I am able to "break in" new shoes. So I ordered Keen Venice sandals and so far no blisters!
customer_reviews.author: gail

customer_reviews.title: Nice sandals
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are made very well. I normally wear 7 1/2 I got an 8 and they fit but tight. Not so much I can't wear them but if I didn't need them right away I would exchange them.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: if ONLY they would make it even quarter inch longer it would be the best shoe ever
customer_reviews.text: They have to be broken in. I do find that they were a tad smallish at first, but the next size up was too big. I have had this issue with other Keens as well. if ONLY they would make it even quarter inch longer it would be the best shoe ever. Otherwise, they are extremely durable and well worth the money. Even tho they are water shoes I use them as approach shoes, too because they are nice and grippy.
customer_reviews.author: Yrofthetiger

customer_reviews.title: Once you go Keen you never go back!
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of Keen sandals. I bought this pair because they were on sale. I suppose some people didn't like the color and that's why they were marked down, but I like it. Not a Kermit green, more a blue green. I think they make my feet look small! I intend to wear them all winter with wool socks until the snow flies, that is. Great tread and good support. My arches are falling and I need good arch support now, so Keen shoes and boots are the way to go for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Small and possibly not as comfortable as previous pairs
customer_reviews.text: I love these sandals and have two other pairs purchased years apart. These seem to have a stiffer and harder sole, so I'm not sure how comfortalbe they'll be. I ordered two pairs, my normal size and a half size up, and the larger size seems closer to the size of my older ones. I have to say, both boxes arrived in a bag and one of the boxes was mauled beyond all recognition by the carrier--the shoes weren't damaged but the cardboard inserts in the shoes were. They need better packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Rowe

customer_reviews.title: I like them and they are quality made just not stretchy ...
customer_reviews.text: Hoping at some point that when I have 0 swelling in my feet I can wear these. I like them and they are quality made just not stretchy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J

customer_reviews.title: so far no bad smells. I use baby powder at times
customer_reviews.text: First pair I purchased were half size too small even though they are the size I normally wear. The second pair are a half size bigger and fit well, especially after I broke them in. I thought I may be able to use my inserts, but the lip at the heal of the shoe isn't high enough. The bottom of my feet do sweat sometimes, so far no bad smells. I use baby powder at times, before putting on. This pair was $10 cheaper, probably due to the color, so they are a little boring.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: Buy half a size up and enjoy the comfort of this shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy this shoe a half size up from my regular 9 because of the width of my foot. It is one of the most comfortable and supportive shoes that I have ever worn, and I buy European comfort type shoes. My podiatrist even let me wear Keens like this after a bunionectomy surgery because he said it gave the same strong support as a surgical shoe. Plus, it is a lot more comfortable than surgical shoes. I recommend this shoe to anyone who needs extra support for your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable, durable sandals I've found
customer_reviews.text: I love my Keens. I have planters fasciitis and I like to hike a lot over rough terrain. I had the same pair of leather ones forever and finally needed a new pair bc they stretched out so much. I've tried a number of Keen's different lines and this is by far the best. The right sandal has a weird ridge on the instep and I blistered there the first few times I wore them, but after a few good uses, they've broken in well.
customer_reviews.author: Jessa P

customer_reviews.title: These are great sturdy sandals
customer_reviews.text: These are great sturdy sandals! Keep my toes protected and they're very supportive. They'd be great for hiking but I mostly wear them for bumming around, running errands with my kids, etc. Not the cutest or stylish but that's not what they're for!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Great sandal
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Keen's for years. You can always count on Keen's to be true to size, comfortable, and the highest quality.
customer_reviews.author: chris grant

customer_reviews.title: GREAT sandals for pained heels
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love these shoes. I have plantar's faciitis and Keen's sandals (especially the Venice version) are the only kind of sandal that does not cause incredible pain, so I needed another pair to add to my aging collection of two previous pairs. I love the color, have already worn them on a weekend getaway where they weathered the beach very well. FANTASTIC shoes at a terrific sale price!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne K Rudofker

customer_reviews.title: Reliable support and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair 15 years ago and wondered if this my second pair would be as sturdy and comfortable... YES!!! These Keens are as supportive and comfortable my originals!
customer_reviews.author: LMG

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: After many years I had worn out a previous pair and needed a replacement. Thet're just the right amount of support for me--not too stiff or too flexible. Even my orthopedic doctor approved.
customer_reviews.author: PCO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Rugged Trips
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were recommended to me for my trip to Africa where I would be doing a lot of hiking in the desert/rugged regions. I was hesitant to spend so much money on a pair of shoes, but oh my goodness, was it worth it! These shoes protected my feet, yet kept them cool enough in the HOT weather. I have sports injuries to my knees which cause chronic pain. Usually after a day of hiking I'm popping the Advil. Not after these shoes! After hiking 4 hours through the mountains and my knees couldn't even tell. I had no pain! They're SUPER comfortable. HIGHLY recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Enat

customer_reviews.title: Love Keens
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Venice and my fourth pair of Keen sandels. I have wide feet with bunions. Keen sandels are so comfortable, with hardly any breaking in time. Even though they are mainly boating sandels, I use them for street walking, and can walk for miles in them. Just recently took a trip to San Francisco walking up those steep hills. These shoes are great for that kind of thing. They cover your feet enough to protect them from the elements but give you breathing space for rain or warm air.
customer_reviews.author: Starfire

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoe!
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfectly and required NO break in time! I also bought a pair of Venice H2, same size, at the same time. Those were stiff and made my feet sore in the arches after a couple hours of wearing them around the house. The toe box felt almost too snug. This is my 3rd pair of Keen sandals. I love that I can wear these around town or hiking in them. I will be buying more pairs of this style.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were exactly what I was looking for. They are a beautiful shoe. Unfortunately the sizing Is way off. I'm always an 8.5 That's what I purchased. The Keen felt more like a 7.5. I didn't know what size to order so I sadly returned them for refund. If I see in a store might try on to see what size I would need. Disappointed because was looking forward to bringing them in vacation. Im sure if you can figure out what size to purchase would be an awesome shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Rose

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love them. I shopped around and saw this exact pair at REI. I held of on purchasing them until I went to Amazon. They were, of course, $30 less on Amazon. That's a BIG difference in price. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Karen K.

customer_reviews.title: These are great. They have logged many miles in wet and ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They have logged many miles in wet and dry conditions and have held up great. They required a little breaking in at the ankle for comfort but no blisters. They are holding up great and unfortunately still look new!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: if you can send 8 1/2 size I'll be just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't order size 5 too small for my size 8 1/2. I don't have a vehicle to find ups store to return this product. If you have the option to pick up this product at my address it would be a great help. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca Carvajal

customer_reviews.title: Another 1/2 size or more larger would have been perfect. ORDER A SIZE LARGER THAN YOU THINK YOU'LL ...
customer_reviews.text: Before ordering this sandal I was very careful to measure my foot size according to the Keen guidelines. When the sandal came in it was too short. Another 1/2 size or more larger would have been perfect. ORDER A SIZE LARGER THAN YOU THINK YOU'LL NEED.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this shoe. The first pair I wore nearly every day for over 3 years. I love these for work. They are comfortable and easy to keep clean. I have a job where I spend a fair amount of time both in the field and in a laboratory. Good also for hiking. I recommend getting a 1/2 size smaller because they tend to stretch out a bit after getting them wet. They have a nice wide toe box. No pinched toes.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Not enough arch support
customer_reviews.text: I love the way these sandals look, fit, and feel. I was able to wear them straight out of the box with no problem. Now after several uses though I really like these shoes I am not completely happy with them. They don't have enough support on the arch of my foot. After a simple five mile day hike I return home with aching soar feet and heals that I don't have with other shoes. Though I really like them and will continue to wear them for this price I will not be purchasing them again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and style
customer_reviews.text: These fit great. I have a wide feet and originally purchased the Whisper style which were too tight and not comfortable after a whole day of wearing them. This Venice fit much better and my feet did not hurt at all even in the "breaking in" first day wearing them. They were even more comfortable after stretching out a bit. I recommend this style if you have problem or wider feet or need more arch support. The style is nice and don't look too clunky on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Glo120

customer_reviews.title: If a rounded toe box is not for you..neither is this shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very rounded and hard toe box made these shoe uncomfortable for me. I'm a very standard 8M and my toes hit the toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent (as always)
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Keen Venice Sandals. I loved the first one but after seven years of intensive use, the sole worn out. I was so happy with the sandals that I decided to buy a new pair. The color is slightly more teal than in the picture but it makes them even more beautiful. I can't be happier with these shoes. This particular color is also reasonably priced. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Arika LZ

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned these sandals for about a week, but I love them. I wasn't sure what size to order given the company's recommendation to order a size larger because it supposedly runs small. I am normally a size 8, and I ordered a size 8. They fit perfectly. They are incredibly comfortable and supportive. I usually get very sweaty feet, but I did not notice much sweating while wearing these around. I haven't been able to wear them hiking yet, so this review is just in terms of wearing them around my work, house, and yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jeni

customer_reviews.title: These are all purpose footwear...
customer_reviews.text: These Keens are great for EVERYTHING!! I wear them for my hot Arizona morning walks, wear them to physical therapy, waterproof, and they protect my toes, and they are just plain comfortable and roomy. Love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Ullstrup

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: Keen makes a nice pair of shoes my wife wears them for work they work good
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: my favorite summer shoe....by far....works with plantar fasciatis feet (at least MINE)
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that these and the Venice H2O sandals, are my favorite summer sandal style. I just wish they had more zingy bright colors (I'm looking for a bright 2-tone teal....hint hint). Easy to get on my foot (I use a shoe horn mostly because my gimpy knees don't turn the right way any longer), comfortable and not a tinge of the plantar fasciatis I get with 'cheap' shoes. Let's just say I have 5 pairs so far....in different colors. Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: bothellbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great support and looks!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try these as I have not had very good luck with other similar styles in different brands. My niece had a Keen size 7 similar style so I tried it on to make sure it would be okay. I usually wear a 6.5 but need a 7 when the shoe is closed in. These have great support and I have been wearing them around as they are also very ventilated and keep my feet cool in the hot weather. Very pleased with the service from Amazon.com and the price. Would highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Best & most comfortable sandal ever!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this sandal. Bought for myself and this is the second pair I have owned!!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Mauser

customer_reviews.title: Love this sandal
customer_reviews.text: I love keens!! This sandal is great...I have plantar fasciitis and this show does not hurt my foot. I have worn them all day long and they feel great! I ordered a half size larger and the fit was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: picassojilly

product_meta.title: KEEN Venice-w, Women’s Venice-w
feature_bullets: Mixed-materials sandal with rubber toe bumper and adjustable bungee closure
